Sarah is a biostatistics consultant and trainer. She runs EMBL's [Centre for Statistical Data Analysis](https://bio-it.embl.de/centres/csda/) which supports EMBL researchers in scientific coding and applying adequate statistical methods to answer biological questions. She offers internal and external training, as well as [on-demand training materials](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/training/trainers/sarah-kaspar).

Sarah received her PhD from Heidelberg University, where she developed mathematical models for bacterial gene expression. She joined EMBL in 2020 as part of the Huber group and the Centre for Statistical Data Analysis.
